newsitem.title: UK: Dr Solomon's warns of fall in growth rate.
newsitem.headline: Dr Solomon's warns of fall in growth rate.

text.p: British anti-virus software supplier Dr Solomon's Group Plc on Thursday reported record fourth quarter profits but warned revenue growth was likely to slow in the current year.

In the three months to May 31 1997, Dr Solomon's operating profits rose by 117 percent to 3.1 million stg from 1.4 million in the same period last year. Turnover climbed 78 percent to 11.7 million from 6.6 million.
The EASDAQ listed group said annual turnover was boosted by an increased number of macro viruses worldwide but predicted the growth rate of macro viruses would fall in the current fiscal year.
"We don't expect the same sort of growth this year but you just never know what is going to happen next in this market," chief executive Geoff Leary told Reuters.

Dr Solomon's said it had strengthened its product line with the release of Dr Solomon's MailGuard for protecting mail servers and Dr Solomon's Anti-Virus for Lotus Domino for the protection of databases from computer viruses.
The group said it would continue to sales growth internationally and highlighted a 98 percent increase in fourth quarter sales in the U.S. from the previous quarter.
The UK accounted for 59 percent of annual turnover with 15 percent coming from the U.S. and 10 percent from Germany.
